author: jnm2
body:
The latest stable image for Nano Server is [`6.0.2-nanoserver-1709`](https://hub.docker.com/r/microsoft/powershell/). Is 6.0.2 in the works for 1803?

(Looks like a matter of bumping a couple things in [https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docker/release/nanoserver/Dockerfile](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docker/release/nanoserver/Dockerfile)?)

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @jnm2 It takes a few weeks after the image is released before we can bring up a build server.  I'm working on getting the build server ready now.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
@jnm2 It can take several days to get the server working as our scripts to set up a build machine is intended for a server with the desktop experience and 1709/1803 are not available with the desktop experience.

No docker file changes are needed.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I have a build server ready and I'm making changes to the official build to build for both 1709 and 1803.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
FYI, no changes are needed to the docker file because you can specify the tags as args.  Here is a command similar to what we use, only with sensitive information removed:

- 1709
  - docker.exe build -f .\nanoserver\Dockerfile --build-arg NanoServerVersion=1709_KB4103727 --build-arg PS_VERSION=6.0.2 --build-arg VCS_REF=9f25daa059a3eed1ea1eb06605be90cd84d3ebe1 --build-arg WindowsServerCoreVersion=1709 -t microsoft/powershell:6.0.2-nanoserver-1709_KB4103727 
- 1803
  - docker.exe build -f .\nanoserver\Dockerfile --build-arg NanoServerVersion=1803_KB4103721 --build-arg PS_VERSION=6.0.2 --build-arg VCS_REF=9f25daa059a3eed1ea1eb06605be90cd84d3ebe1 --build-arg WindowsServerCoreVersion=1709 -t microsoft/powershell:6.0.2-nanoserver-1803_KB4103721

**Note:**  I use 1709 of windowsservercore always because the image is large and because it is not part of the final image there is not need to use 1803, but I leave the parameter in the build because if docker is in process isolation, I must use the container matching the host OS.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
done `docker run -it mcr.microsoft.com/powershell:6.0.2-nanoserver-1803`
I created the `nanoserver` tag but there is an issue getting it to work on the mcr.microsoft.com preview.  you have to use `docker run -it microsoft/powershell:nanoserver` 

Hopefully it will be resolved soon

comments.author: jnm2
comments.body: Up and running with it! Thank you for your speedy response!
